question_stem:
Suppose that we wish to find the smallest positive root of the following equation: y=sin(x)−x2−0.1 y = \sin(x) - \frac{x}{2} - 0.1 
Write a function f(x) in R that implements the above equation, and then use uniroot to solve for the smallest positive root. Print the value of the root found.
Note: A simple implementation of ff will garner more marks than one that does not make use of the vectorised operations in R.

Write a function f(x) in R that implements the above equation, and then use uniroot to solve for the smallest positive root. Print the value of the root found.

Note: A simple implementation of ff will garner more marks than one that does not make use of the vectorised operations in R.
items.solution_html:
f <- function(x) {
  sin(x) - x/2 - 0.1
}
output <- uniroot(f, c(0, 0.5))
print(output$root)
## [1] 0.2027729
